title: Support Package Procedure For Participation In Eu-European Research Council (Erc) Projects(PSUATT-A610-01-07) | Yönerge
text: Procedure No PSUATT-A610-01-07V02 Effective Date 31-03-2023 Update Date 24-04-2025 Related Unit / Owner SUATT / Araştırma Geliştirme ve Teknoloji Transfer Ofisi Approved by MH / Mütevelli Heyeti Related Instruction Araştırma Projeleri Süreçlerinin Yönetilmesi Yönergesi (ISUATT-A610-01) Aim This procedure aims to provide a support package to the European Research Council (ERC), which is an important part of the European Union funds, in order to increase the number of project applications and acceptances, to encourage the applications of faculty members and researchers and to increase motivation. In this way, the Institution aims to support faculty members and researchers with additional incentives for their contributions throughout the process in ERC projects where competition is high. Scope This document covers the additional support provided to faculty members and researchers during the ERC project application phase, after the application is made, and during the post-acceptance execution phase. It also includes additional support provided to researchers whose ERC projects are accepted from outside SU, during the post-acceptance execution phase. This support is defined for the Starting Grant, Consolidator Grant and Advanced Grant categories under ERC. Definitions / Abbreviations EU: European Union APES: Researcher Performance System APG: Research Process Planning and Policy Development Unit ERC: European Research Council ERC Committee: This is the committee where ERC coordination is carried out. The committee consists of the Vice President for Research, Faculty Deans, SUATT Director, and the President for consultation purposes. The coordination of the Committee is supported by PP Managers. KAF: Personal Research Fund PAF: Project Research Fund PP: Faculty of Engineering and Natural Sciences Project Partners, Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences Project Partners, Sabancı Business School Project Partners PY: Project Manager is responsible for directing the scientific studies of the project, ensuring the use of project financial support in accordance with the rules, monitoring and executing it in accordance with the relevant SU procedures, and managing the research. PMO: Research Projects Management Office SUATT: Research, Development and Technology Transfer Office Directorate SU: Sabancı University URC: University Research Council Implementation Steps Responsibility Outputs/Timing Before Application: In order for academics who plan to do an ERC project to benefit from SU ERC supports and receive an ERC application support letter, permission must be obtained from the ERC committee before writing the project. ERC Support Package Structure There are three categories of support mechanisms. 1. At the Project Application Stage: 1.1. Applicants who are decided to receive consultancy support by the ERC Committee are provided with professional consultancy services. It can be provided in different ways such as 1:1 writing support, interview preparation support, project writing camps support with consultancy companies that SU has agreements with. 1.2. Course load reduction can be applied during the project writing phase. This application takes place with the approval of the Dean, according to the faculty course load availability in the relevant period. 1.3. For applicants who have progressed to the interview stage, a "mock interview" is organized at SU, in addition to consultancy support, if desired. 1.4. Mentoring support can be obtained by contacting researchers who have previously received ERC. 1.5. When the projects of researchers who benefit from consultancy support are completed, an application is made through SU. 2. When the Project Application is Made (those with A and B scores): 2.1. Additional points are given to PY by the faculties in the KAF calculations during that year. 2.2. Additional incentive is given to PAF account for those who get A score. 3. After Project Acceptance / During the Execution Phase: 3.1. PI fees included in the ERC budget are paid in addition to the existing salary. 3.2. A certain percentage of the project "overhead" amount is allocated to the applicant's free use within the scope of the project. 3.3. During the project, the course load is reduced upon the Dean's evaluation. 3.4. Additional points are given for APES and KAF calculations. 3.5. PYs who successfully complete their projects are given the Achievement Award. 3.6. After the ERC project is completed, a full scholarship support is provided to a doctoral student for 3 years. PP & Faculties & PY Outputs PY Application Form Application Date PY's project application/result/acceptance process 4. Evaluation and Acceptance Process 2.1. All requests and opportunities are evaluated in the ERC Committee. 2.2. In the ERC Committee, the PY's request is evaluated and a decision is made as to which consultancy service they will receive during the application phase. The relevant PP Manager notifies the evaluation result to the PY by e-mail. PY & ERC Committee Evaluation After the request according to ERC call dates 5. Managing the Support Package 5.1. Budgetary management of the ERC Support Package is carried out within the framework of the Research Projects Management Procedure. 5.2. The management of Consultancy service procurements of the ERC Support Package is monitored with the support of SUATT-PP Managers. 5.3. APES and KAF connections of the ERC Support Package are managed by the Dean's Office. 5.4. The Achievement Award phase of the ERC Support Package is managed by the ERC Committee. Faculties, PY & PMO Officer & PP & APG Outputs Consultancy service procurement Timing During the project 6. Closing the ERC Support Package 6.1. Information about the closure of projects whose final report is deemed appropriate is shared in the URC. 6.2. The project is closed according to the "Research Projects Management Procedure".
